Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of health care law requirements on a company with 20 employees, suggesting that they will go out of business solely because of these requirements.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the health care law requirements to buy insurance will directly lead to a company going out of business, without considering alternative factors or options.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that a company with 20 employees will be unable to afford health care for anybody and will go out of business.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation by stating that businesses with fewer than 50 full-time employees are not required to offer coverage under the health care law. This challenges the claim's assumption that the requirements will directly lead to business closure.
